meanings.sent1: She is very dateable and always gets asked out.
meanings.sent2: He found her to be quite dateable and enjoyed spending time with her.
meanings.sent3: Being dateable makes it easier to find a romantic partner.
meanings.sent4: Her friendly personality makes her incredibly dateable to many people.
meanings.sent5: The charming smile she has makes her undeniably dateable.

meanings.definition: Able to be dated or assigned a date.
meanings.sent1: The old manuscript was not dateable due to missing information.
meanings.sent2: The artifact was dateable to the 15th century based on its design.
meanings.sent3: Trying to make the undateable dateable is a challenging task.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins were surprisingly dateable by the markings found.
meanings.sent5: The fossil was easily dateable by the layers of sediment surrounding it.

meanings.definition: Capable of being dated or estimated.
meanings.sent1: The event was not dateable accurately due to conflicting reports.
meanings.sent2: The rock formation was dateable to millions of years old.
meanings.sent3: Estimating the age of the tree was proving to be quite dateable.
meanings.sent4: The age of the universe is a dateable concept for scientists.
meanings.sent5: The historical document was dateable within a few decades of its creation.
